attributes.action: Initiate a motion of no confidence in the current government.
attributes.additional_details:
The House of Lords has no confidence in the government:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/tax-credit-cuts-delayed-by-house-of-lords-hollis-amendment-osborne-a6709846.html

Pre-election David Cameron said categorically that tax credits wouldn't fall: https://youtu.be/CxS-Tow-Qik and yet the chancellor responds thus: http://youtu.be/V1vJMtx4iko

The levels of incompetence and dishonesty, is surely strong evidence for a motion of no confidence under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act 2011.
attributes.background: In light of recent events, in which the House of Lords was obliged to step in regarding the government's economic plan, and through which the government flagrantly broke pre-election promises, it is clear that the current government is incapable of delivering the mandate for which it was elected.
